info_text: My name is Krzysztof Szymała, and I am a cognitive science student at the University of Silesia in Katowice. My research concerns differences in the perception of visual stimuli between meditating and non-meditating individuals. This study is part of my master's thesis, titled "Effects of meditation techniques on selected human cognitive processes." Participation in this study will help explore the impact of meditation on our perceptual abilities. Your decision to participate in this study is entirely voluntary, and you may withdraw at any time without giving a reason. All data collected during the study will be treated confidentially and used exclusively for scientific purposes. The results will be analyzed in an aggregated form, meaning that individual participant data will not be disclosed. Participation in the study involves no risks, and the information obtained may contribute to a better understanding of how meditation affects cognitive processes.
training_instructions_text: This is a training series where you can get familiar with the application's functionality and the experiment. A series of images will appear on the screen, with an exposure time of 300 ms. After each image, a question will appear asking what was shown on the screen. Make sure to perform the experiment in a well-lit room. If it is nighttime, it is recommended to turn on the light to ensure good visibility conditions.
training_question: What did you see in the image?
experiment_instructions_text: You will see a series of images displayed on the screen with different exposure times. After each image, you will be asked a question about what was shown. If you are not sure about the answer, please do not guess – select 'I don't know'. Make sure to perform the experiment in a well-lit room. If it is nighttime, it is recommended to turn on the light to ensure good visibility conditions.
experiment_question: What did you see in the image?

results.title: Results
results.thanks: Thank you for participating in the study!
results.feedback_title: Share your feedback about the study or provide your comments
